page.title: 06Transport - Sealand Area.
page.content: In the last few years great efforts have been made to improve the roads in our area.At weekends the traffic is very heavy indeed,with many tourists in cars,buses and caravans going into North Wales.We are just on the edge of the motorway network.We are only a few miles away from the M56 which takes us to the M6 motorway and from there we can travel to all parts of Britain.Our area has many bus services.We can go to Chester,Liverpool,Manchester and London as well as local buses to Mold,Rhyl,Queensferry and Caernarfon. We have no stations although the main London to Holyhead line cuts our rectangle in half.The nearest station is Shotton,but Chester is only some five miles away.If we need to fly we have Ringway Manchester or Speke at Liverpool.
